isoMatches.title: Tractors and machinery for agriculture and forestry — Safety-related parts of control systems — Part 1: General principles for design and development
isoMatches.reason: Provides general principles for safety-related parts of control systems (SRP/CS) in agricultural machinery, including categorization and design considerations for safety functions, which supports implementing redundant access to mode switching and safe system behavior.

isoMatches.title: IEC 62061 Consolidated version – Safety of machinery - Functional safety of safety-related control systems
isoMatches.reason: Machinery functional safety standard specifying requirements for the design, integration and validation of safety-related electrical/electronic control systems, supporting high/continuous demand safety functions and redundancy considerations for mode switching.

isoMatches.title: Safety of machinery — General principles for design — Risk assessment and risk reduction
isoMatches.reason: Provides fundamental risk assessment and risk reduction framework and information for use, underpinning clear, multi-language user instructions and diagrammatic content in manuals.

isoMatches.title: Safety of machinery — Instruction handbook — General drafting principles
isoMatches.reason: Specifies structure and presentation requirements for instruction handbooks, supporting the mandated two-format (diagrams and textual descriptions) and multilingual documentation.

isoMatches.title: Graphical symbols — Safety colours and safety signs — Registered safety signs
isoMatches.reason: Provides standardized safety signs and symbols to support diagrams in manuals and multilingual communication, aiding clear identification of mode-access points across languages.

isoMatches.title: Safety of machinery — Safety-related parts of control systems — Part 1: General principles for design
isoMatches.reason: Defines methodology for design and integration of safety-related parts of control systems (SRP/CS), including architecture, fault tolerance, and performance levels, directly informing redundancy and safe operation of mode-switch access points.

data.content: Autonomous mode fails to start

isoMatches.title: Safety of machinery - Electrical equipment of machines - Part 1: General requirements
isoMatches.reason: Provides requirements for emergency stop (including stop categories) and how E‑stop overrides other functions, supports the mandated Stop Category choice (0 or 1) and non-restart behavior after resetting; clarifies interaction with electrical control systems for machines such as tractors.

isoMatches.title: Safety of machinery — Emergency stop function — Principles for design
isoMatches.reason: Defines the fundamental design principles for emergency stop devices applicable to all machines; complements 60204-1 by detailing the E‑stop function itself and ensuring it is clearly identifiable and accessible.

isoMatches.title: Safety of machinery – Functional safety of safety-related electrical, electronic and programmable electronic control systems
isoMatches.reason: Provides system‑level functional safety requirements for SRP/CS, including safety requirements, verification and validation, and performance criteria that underpin time‑to‑stop and safe restart considerations described in the safety requirement.

isoMatches.title: Safety of machinery — Safety-related parts of control systems — Part 1: General principles for design
isoMatches.reason: Offers methodology for designing SRP/CS with performance levels (PLr) and architectures suitable for high-demand/continuous operations; supports justification of redundancy and multiple safety-related control paths in emergency stop systems.

isoMatches.title: Tractors and machinery for agriculture and forestry — Safety-related parts of control systems — Part 1: General principles for design and development
isoMatches.reason: Industry-specific SRP/CS standard for agricultural machinery; addresses the safety lifecycle, system architecture and responsibilities for safety-related control systems in tractors and similar machines, including emergency stop and mode-switching behaviors.

isoMatches.title: Preparation of information for use (instructions for use) of products — Part 1: Principles and general requirements
isoMatches.reason: Provides principles and requirements for information for use, enabling clear, diagrammatic and multilingual instructions; directly supports requirement 2 on multi-format, multilingual operator instructions with diagrams and textual descriptions.

isoMatches.title: Graphical symbols — Safety colours and safety signs — Registered safety signs
isoMatches.reason: Establishes standardized safety signs for emergency stops and other warnings, ensuring consistent visual communication of E‑stop locations and meanings across jurisdictions.

isoMatches.title: Safety of machinery — Interlocking devices associated with guards — Principles for design and selection
isoMatches.reason: Addresses interlocking devices and guarding strategies, including how interlocks interact with safety functions and how multiple access points can be managed safely; relevant to design of multi-point access for mode switches and safe guard interactions.

data.content: The autonomous mode starts before the operator leaves the tractor
Sofeware error
The tractor cannot move, causing time loss.
Additional injury to the operator when a collision occurs

Provide at least two distinct means of access to the mode switch (for redundancy and safety, e.g., a mechanical button reachable when the operator is outside the tractor and an access on the control panel), while minimizing the complexity introduced by multiple access points

Provide 100% knowable instructions in the user manual on how to switch modes (for good decision support when autonomous mode fails to start, to reduce possible human errors), considering the diverse educational levels of the intended users. Instructions shall be provided in at least two formats: (1) diagrams showing the appearance and location of the access points, and (2) textual descriptions explaining the operations in detail. Multiple languages and clear definitions of terminology shall be provided to meet the needs of users with different educational backgrounds

Set up an independent emergency stop function that shall stop all hazardous motions and should be clearly marked and easily accessible. It shall only be reset by a deliberate manual action that does not cause a restart after resetting but shall only permit a restart to occur. The following information shall be provided: (a) stop category according to IEC 60204-1:2016 + AMD1: 2021. (b) span-of-control of the emergency stop; (c) maximum response time for the emergency stop, as measured from input state change until the termination of the hazardous function of the tractor. (d) maximum stopping time for the emergency stop, as measured from input state change until the termination of hazard function(s) of the tractor
Sofeware error

control the tractor mobile base in manual mode

isoMatches.title: Road vehicles — Safety of the intended functionality
isoMatches.reason: Addresses safety risks due to perception/functional insufficiencies in autonomous perception, providing design, design-validation and V&V guidance for perception modules (e.g., image quality under adverse conditions) to prevent unreasonable risk during autonomous operation.

isoMatches.title: Tractors and machinery for agriculture and forestry — Safety-related parts of control systems — Part 2: Concept phase
isoMatches.reason: Defines the concept phase (hazard analysis and risk assessment) for SRP/CS in agricultural machinery, aligning with requirement to document test conditions and safety goals early in the lifecycle.

isoMatches.title: Tractors and machinery for agriculture and forestry — Safety-related parts of control systems — Part 3: Series development, hardware and software
isoMatches.reason: Specifies principles for series development of SRP/CS hardware/software, enabling proper implementation and testing of perception and safety functions (including the image-quality modules) across the development lifecycle.

isoMatches.title: Tractors and machinery for agriculture and forestry — Safety-related parts of control systems — Part 4: Production, operation, modification and supporting processes
isoMatches.reason: Covers production, operation, modification and supporting processes for SRP/CS, ensuring traceability, change control and validation of safety-related features in the field.

isoMatches.title: Safety of machinery — Electrical equipment of machines — Part 1: General requirements
isoMatches.reason: Provides requirements for electrical equipment, including emergency stop implementation and safe restart considerations, essential to meet requirement 2.

isoMatches.title: Safety of machinery — Emergency stop function — Principles for design
isoMatches.reason: Defines the design principles for emergency stop devices and restart conditions, complementing IEC 60204-1 for reliable stop/restart behavior.

isoMatches.title: Luminaires — Part 1: General requirements and tests
isoMatches.reason: Covers safety requirements and testing for lighting equipment used in the machine, supporting requirement 3 testing of the lighting system.

isoMatches.title: Digital cameras — Resolution and spatial frequency responses
isoMatches.reason: Defines standardized methods to measure camera resolution/SFR, enabling objective evaluation in the objective image-quality module.

isoMatches.title: Photography — Electronic still-picture imaging — Noise measurements
isoMatches.reason: Specifies methods for measuring camera noise and dynamic range, supporting objective image-quality evaluation under adverse conditions.

isoMatches.title: Microscopes — Definition and measurement of illumination properties — Part 1: Image brightness and uniformity in bright field microscopy
isoMatches.reason: Provides procedures to measure image brightness and uniformity, aiding brightness tests in imaging systems used for perception modules.

Specify limitations on maximum driving and turning speeds for different types of risky weather conditions in autonomous mode in the user manual, providing 100% fully clear instructions for manually selecting operating conditions or setting speed limits (for good decision support to reduce human errors), considering the diverse educational levels of the intended users

Set up two image quality assessment modules: a subjective test module where humans can access captured images and provide evaluations, and an objective test module where computational software enables comparison between reference and target images. Use images with rain droplets, snow particles, and dust to simulate extreme conditions. Compare the modules’ outputs with known benchmarks for images in similar conditions. The verification and validation methods are review of the documentation and information for use, practical tests, and simulation tests. Record the test conditions. Quality assessment is expected to start once autonomous mode starts. The captured images shall be tested for brightness, resolution, contrast, noise, and blur. The system shall provide instant feedback on whether the series of input images is valid for autonomous navigation. If not, autonomous mode shall be disabled
Test the lighting system. The verification and validation methods are visual inspection, observation during operation, review of specifications and information for use, and practical tests

Set limitations on sensing and automation-related zones in the user manual, providing 100% fully clear instructions (for good decision support to reduce human errors), considering the diverse educational levels of the intended users

isoMatches.title: Road vehicles — Safety of the intended functionality
isoMatches.reason: Provides guidance on Safety of the Intended Functionality (SOTIF), including handling hazards due to functional insufficiencies under adverse weather and the concept of the operational design domain (ODD); supports explicit specification of weather-related operating limits and manual mode/condition selection in user guidance, addressing safety across users with varying education levels.

isoMatches.title: Road vehicles — Functional safety — Part 6: Product development at the software level
isoMatches.reason: Defines the safety-focused software development lifecycle, enabling specification, implementation and verification of speed-control logic and mode-selection features used in autonomous driving; supports producing clear, testable software safety requirements (including user-facing operational guidance) accessible to users with diverse education levels.

isoMatches.title: Road vehicles — Functional safety — Part 5: Product development at the hardware level
isoMatches.reason: Covers hardware safety requirements for safety-related E/E systems involved in speed control (e.g., sensors, actuators), ensuring reliable operation of speed-management features under degraded weather conditions and safe interaction with software controls.

isoMatches.title: Road vehicles — Functional safety — Part 7: Production, operation, service and decommissioning
isoMatches.reason: Addresses production and operation safety aspects, ensuring that safety requirements and user guidance (such as manual speed-limit selection) are correctly implemented, maintained in operation, and supported by service and documentation.

isoMatches.title: Tractors and machinery for agriculture and forestry — Safety-related parts of control systems — Part 1: General principles for design and development
isoMatches.reason: Provides general principles for designing and developing safety-related parts of control systems in agricultural machinery, which is directly relevant to implementing and documenting safe speed control under varying weather and operating conditions in the autonomous mode of an agricultural tracker.

isoMatches.title: Safety of machinery — Safety-related parts of control systems — Part 1: General principles for design
isoMatches.reason: Provides modern design principles for safety-related control systems (SRP/CS) applicable across machinery types, including autonomous agricultural trackers, to ensure robust safety functions such as speed control under adverse conditions.

isoMatches.title: Ergonomics of human-system interaction — Part 11: Usability: Definitions and concepts
isoMatches.reason: Defines usability concepts essential for ensuring that manual and automated safety instructions are understandable across diverse educational levels, supporting clear, unambiguous speed-limit and operating-condition guidance in the user manual.

isoMatches.title: Ergonomics of human-system interaction — Part 210: Human-centred design for interactive systems
isoMatches.reason: Promotes human-centred design processes for interactive systems, including consideration of user needs and contexts, to ensure safety-related information (e.g., speed limits under risky weather) is comprehensible and usable by operators with varying backgrounds.

isoMatches.title: Safety of machinery - Functional safety of safety-related control systems
isoMatches.reason: Provides requirements for the design, integration, and validation of safety-related electrical/electronic/programmable electronic control systems (SRECS) for machines, including software components that implement safety functions (e.g., trajectory planning). Establishes a safety lifecycle with verification/validation activities and criteria for testing before deployment.

isoMatches.title: Robotics — Safety requirements — Part 1: Industrial robots
isoMatches.reason: Covers safety requirements for industrial robots and the information for use to accompany them, including calibration and operation guidance. Supports clear, accessible documentation to accommodate diverse educational levels of users.

isoMatches.title: ISO/IEC/IEEE 12207: Systems and software engineering — Software life cycle processes
isoMatches.reason: Provides a structured framework for software life cycle activities including verification and validation, test planning, and documentation of test criteria and results. This supports defining measurable acceptance criteria and recording test conditions for trajectory planning algorithms in both simulation and real hardware.

isoMatches.title: Manipulating industrial robots — Performance criteria and related test methods
isoMatches.reason: Defines performance criteria and test methods for robotic manipulators, enabling objective measurement of trajectory accuracy, repeatability, and path-following—useful for evaluating the trajectory planning algorithm in both simulation and real implementation.

isoMatches.title: Robotics — Safety requirements — Part 2: Industrial robot applications and robot cells
isoMatches.reason: Safety requirements for the integration, commissioning, operation and testing of industrial robot systems. Supports safe on-machine testing and validation of robotic trajectory control within a production environment.

isoMatches.title: Robotics — Safety requirements — Part 1: Industrial robots
isoMatches.reason: Safety requirements for industrial robots; provides baseline safety considerations that underpin safe testing and validation of robotic control software and calibration activities.

isoMatches.title: ISO/IEC 17025: General requirements for the competence of testing and calibration laboratories
isoMatches.reason: Addresses competence and impartiality of laboratories and requires documented calibration methods and traceability. Supports calibration activities and the assurance of measurement accuracy used during trajectory testing and validation.

isoMatches.title: Ergonomics principles in the design of work systems
isoMatches.reason: Ergonomic principles for designing work systems, informing how calibration procedures and interfaces are organized to minimize human error and ensure safe, effective use by diverse users.

isoMatches.title: Ergonomics of human-system interaction — Part 210: Human-centred design for interactive systems
isoMatches.reason: Guides human-centered design of interactive systems, including usability and accessibility of instructions. Supports creating calibration guidance and manuals that are understandable across different education levels.

isoMatches.title: Safety of machinery — General principles for design — Risk assessment and risk reduction
isoMatches.reason: Provides a framework for risk assessment and reduction during machinery design and lifecycle, including how testing and calibration activities should consider hazards and safety requirements.

isoMatches.title: Safety of machinery — General principles for design — Risk assessment and risk reduction
isoMatches.reason: Provides the fundamental framework for identifying hazards, assessing risks, and applying risk reduction throughout the machine life cycle, enabling definition of operator limits, safe operating requirements, and protective measures in the cab.

isoMatches.title: IEC 62061: Safety of machinery - Functional safety of safety-related control systems
isoMatches.reason: Specifies requirements for the design, integration and validation of safety-related control systems in machines, guiding the implementation of protective measures in the cab’s electrical/electronic control architecture and ensuring appropriate safety function performance.

isoMatches.title: Safety of machinery — Safety-related parts of control systems — Part 1: General principles for design
isoMatches.reason: Provides the design framework and performance level concept for safety-related parts of control systems, supporting the specification of safety functions and robustness of control-system safety in the cab.

isoMatches.title: Safety of machinery — Guards — General requirements for the design and construction of fixed and movable guards
isoMatches.reason: Defines requirements for fixed/movable guards to protect operators from mechanical hazards, informing cab guarding and enclosure design.

isoMatches.title: Safety of machinery — Safety distances to prevent hazard zones being reached by upper and lower limbs
isoMatches.reason: Establishes safety distances to prevent access to hazard zones, guiding the layout of cab openings, guard gaps and reach zones.

isoMatches.title: Ergonomics principles in the design of work systems
isoMatches.reason: Sets fundamental ergonomic principles for designing work systems, including operator interactions with seats and control panels, to support human factors in the cab.

isoMatches.title: Ergonomics of human-system interaction — Part 210: Human-centred design for interactive systems
isoMatches.reason: Provides requirements and guidance for human-centred design of interactive controls and displays, ensuring the cab’s control panel and seating support diverse user needs and education levels.

isoMatches.title: Basic human body measurements for technological design — Part 1: Body measurement definitions and landmarks
isoMatches.reason: Offers anthropometric data definitions for designing seating, pedals/controls, and cockpit layout to fit a diverse user population.

isoMatches.title: General requirements for establishing anthropometric databases
isoMatches.reason: Supports the collection and reporting of population anthropometric data to inform seat and control-panel design for diverse users.

isoMatches.title: Mechanical vibration and shock — Evaluation of human exposure to whole-body vibration — Part 1: General requirements
isoMatches.reason: Provides methods to evaluate and limit whole-body vibration exposure, informing seat design and cab mounting to protect operators.

isoMatches.title: Systems and software engineering — Design and development of information for users

isoMatches.title: Systems and software engineering — Requirements for testers and reviewers of information for users
isoMatches.reason: Specifies processes for testing and reviewing user information, ensuring that manuals and instructions are accurate and accessible to users with varying levels of education.
